intro: Taraxacum jaervikylense, commonly known as the Jaervikylä dandelion, is a rare and endemic species native to Finland. It is characterized by its yellow composite flower head and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-rich soils in forested areas. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native habitat.
